clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Parenting and Stress Management Programmme
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a Parenting and Stress Management Programme: An Exploratory Randomised Controlled Trial of Triple P-Positive Parenting Program and Stress Control

brief_summary.textblock: The study will use a randomised controlled trial design to evaluate the effects of a combined intervention of Triple P-Positive Parenting Program Discussion Groups and Stress Control in comparison to a waitlist condition. The combined intervention will be evaluated with parents in Glasgow, United Kingdom, with a 3-8 year old child.

clinical_study.why_stopped: The study was terminated due to time constraints and the withdrawal of Stress Control from the NHS Greater Glasgow and Clyde services.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in dysfunctional parenting practices as measured by the Parenting Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, mid-intervention (approximately 4 weeks after baseline), post-intervention (approximately 12 weeks after baseline), 3-month follow-up (approximately 24 weeks after baseline)
primary_outcome.description: Measures dysfunctional parenting practices: laxness, overreactivity, and verbosity

primary_outcome.measure: Change in symptoms of depression, anxiety and stress as measured by the Depression Anxiety Stress Scales 21
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, mid-intervention (approximately 4 weeks after baseline), post-intervention (approximately 12 weeks after baseline), 3-month follow-up (approximately 24 weeks after baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the frequency of disruptive child behaviours as measured by Eyberg Child Behavior Inventory-Intensity scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-intervention (approximately 12 weeks after baseline), 3-month follow-up (approximately 24 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Measures parents' perceptions of their child's disruptive behaviour

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in positive mental wellbeing as measured by the Short Warwick-Edinburgh Mental Well-being Scale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-intervention (approximately 12 weeks after baseline), 3-month follow-up (approximately 24 weeks after baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parents' perceptions of their parenting experiences as measured by the Parenting Experience Survey
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-intervention (approximately 12 weeks after baseline), 3-month follow-up (approximately 24 weeks after baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parents' perceptions of their parenting self-efficacy as measured by the Child Adjustment and Parent Efficacy Scale-Parent Efficacy subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-intervention (approximately 12 weeks after baseline), 3-month follow-up (approximately 24 weeks after baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in parents' perceptions of their family relationships as measured by the Parenting and Family Adjustment Scale-Family Relationships subscale
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, post-intervention (approximately 12 weeks after baseline), 3-month follow-up (approximately 24 weeks after baseline)

other_outcome.description: Demographic information of the participating families

other_outcome.measure: Parents' satisfaction with the Triple P Discussion Groups and Stress Control, as measured by the Consumer Satisfaction Questionnaire developed for Triple P programmes, and the Consumer Satisfaction Questionnaire developed for Stress Control
The fidelity of the intervention as measured by the Triple P Discussion Group session content checklists, and session content checklists for Stress Control that were developed for this study
other_outcome.time_frame: The practitioner/s delivering the intervention will complete a session content checklist after each Triple P Discussion Group and after each Stress Control session

arm_group.description: The intervention is a combination of Triple P Discussion Groups and Stress Control
Waitlist control. Participants allocated to the waitlist control will be able to access the intervention after post-intervention equivalent measures have been completed.

intervention.intervention_name: Combination of Triple P Discussion Groups and Stress Control
intervention.description: The intervention consists of eight group sessions: two 120 minute Triple P Discussion Group sessions (http://www.triplep.net/), and six 90 minute Stress Control sessions (http://glasgowsteps.com/home.php).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has a child aged between 3 and 8 years old
- Able to attend the group sessions held at Langside Halls, Shawlands in Glasgow, United Kingdom
- Able to read a newspaper without assistance
Exclusion Criteria:
- Child has a diagnosis of a developmental or intellectual disability or other significant health impairment
